TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi StartupEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.Startup> event occurs when the application starts, if the application implements the Visual Basic Application Model. For more information, see [Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
StartupEventArgs contains the command-line arguments of the application and indicates whether the application startup should be canceled.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<string> args) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> object that contains the command-line arguments of the application.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.Startup> event occurs when the application starts, if the application implements the Visual Basic Application Model. For more information, see [Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.StartupEventArgs> contains the command-line arguments of the application and indicates whether the application startup should be canceled.

Docs.summary: Gets the command-line arguments of the application.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> object that contains the command-line arguments of the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.Startup> event occurs when the application starts, if the application implements the Visual Basic Application Model.
